gr.interamerican.bo2.creation.beans
Class ObjectFactoryImpl

java.lang.Object
  gr.interamerican.bo2.creation.beans.ObjectFactoryImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
ObjectFactory
Direct Known Subclasses:
FunctionalMocksObjectFactoryImpl
public class ObjectFactoryImpl
extends Object
implements ObjectFactory

Implementation of ObjectFactory.

The most important features of this implementation of ObjectFactory are:

  • Association of names of declaration and implementation type.
  • Creation or enhancement of implementation types that are not concrete.
  • Constructor selection


    • Associating names between declaration and implementation types
    Association of declaration and implementation type can be defined in properties files. A simple text file that has the paths to these properties files is read by this factory's constructor. The constructor will then load all those properties files on a map that is used for the matching.
    This map is always searched first when trying to resolve the implementation class for a declaration class or vice versa. In case the class being searched does not exist in the above mentioned map, then a NameResolver will try to resolve the names.


    Creation or enhancement of implementation types is delegated to the ClassCreator. This ObjectFactoryImpl uses a ClassCreator that is specified in the properties object that is the argument to its constructor.

    Constructor selection
    The constructor of this factory, takes a Properties object as argument. If this object is provided to the constructor, namely if the argument put to the constructor is not null, then this factory will try to use this properties object as argument for the creation of objects. If the properties field of this factory is not null, then the factory will search each implementation type for a constructor that takes an argument of type Properties. If the implementation type has such a constructor, and the factory's properties is not null, then this constructor will be used, with the same properties object as argument. If this factory has its properties field null, or the implementation class does not have the before mentioned constructor, then the factory will use the implementation class' newInstance() method.

    Field Detail

    REPLACEMENT_IND

    public static final String REPLACEMENT_IND
    Prefix for type replacement file indication.
    The object factory initialization file contains paths to properties files where type mappings are defined. There are to types of type mappings files. One type is a mapping file that maps declaration types to implementation types. The other type is a mapping file that maps declaration to other declaration types. This prefix marks the second type of file.

    See Also:
    Constant Field Values

    ObjectFactoryImpl

    public ObjectFactoryImpl(ObjectFactoryAssistant assistant)
    Creates a new Factory object.

    Parameters:
    assistant - Object factory assistant.

    ObjectFactoryImpl

    public ObjectFactoryImpl(Properties properties)
    Creates a new Factory object using the information defined in a properties file. The properties file should contain the following properties:
  • mappingsFilePath: Path to the mappings file
  • nameResolverClass: Class of the nameResolver
  • hasProperties: Indication if the new factory will have properties. If this property is true, then This constructor will use these properties in order set the type mappings and the nameResolver. The properties passed as argument to the constructor will be the properties of this object.

    • Parameters:
    properties - Properties object used as argument for object creation, wherever there is a constructor that receives this argument.

    Specified by:

    Returns:
    the corresponding declaration type name

    getImplementationType

    public Class<?> getImplementationType(Class<?> declarationType)
    Description copied from interface: ObjectFactory
    Gets the class that is assignable from the specified class and is used by this factory for the instantiation of objects of the specified type. If the type is existing (i.e. it has been created in the past) it is found in the Factory internal store. If it is not existing, the Factory first checks the available type mappings to get an implementation name. If no implementation name is found, the Factory uses a NameResolver in order to get the class name of the default implementation (i.e. gr.intermarican...def...Foo --> gr.interamerican...impl...FooImpl). The Factory goes on to load that class, unless (a) it is abstract or (b) it is an interface. In both of these cases the Factory uses Javassist first in order to convert it to a concrete class which it then loads.

    Specified by:
    getImplementationType in interface ObjectFactory
    Parameters:
    declarationType - Type used as declaration type. Usually this is an interface.
    Returns:
    Returns the type implementing the type defined by the parameter declarationType in this deployment.

    getImplementationType

    public Class<?> getImplementationType(String declarationTypeName)
    Description copied from interface: ObjectFactory
    Returns the implementation type that corresponds to a declaration type name.
    The work is delegated to getImplementationType(Class type) as soon as the declaration type is resolved from the declaration type name.

    Specified by:
    getImplementationType in interface ObjectFactory
    Parameters:
    declarationTypeName - Name of the declaration class
    Returns:
    returns the corresponding implementation type.

    registerImplementationAsDeclaration

    public void registerImplementationAsDeclaration(Class<?> declaration)
    Description copied from interface: ObjectFactory
    Defines that the specified class will be used as declaration and implementation type. This method is provided as a facility, that lets the object factory be aware of concrete classes that do not implement an interface.

    Specified by:
    registerImplementationAsDeclaration in interface ObjectFactory
    Parameters:
    declaration - Concrete class that will be used as declaration and implementation.

    registerFixture

    public <M> void registerFixture(Class<M> declarationType,
                                M fixture)
    Description copied from interface: ObjectFactory
    Registers a fixture that this ObjectFactory will use when the application requires the creation of an object instance for the supplied declarationType
    The normal process for object creation will not be used if a fixture has been set.
    This facility is meant to allow developers to specify mock instances to be created for a declarationType in certain unit testing scenarios where the actual implementation is not available in the classpath.
    The fixtures only affect calls to the ObjectFactory.create(Class) method of the ObjectFactory.

    Specified by:
    registerFixture in interface ObjectFactory
    Type Parameters:
    M - Type of fixture.
    Parameters:
    declarationType - Declaration class
    fixture - Instance to be returned upon a request for a declarationType object creation

    registerFixture

    public <M> void registerFixture(Class<M> declarationType,
                                ObjectFactory fixtureFactory)
    Description copied from interface: ObjectFactory
    Registers a fixture that this ObjectFactory will use when the application requires the creation of an object instance for the supplied declarationType
    The normal process for object creation will not be used if a fixture has been set.
    This facility is meant to allow developers to specify ObjectFactory instances that will be used for the instantiation of a declarationType in certain unit testing scenarios where the actual implementation is not available in the classpath.
    The fixtures only affect calls to the ObjectFactory.create(Class) method of this ObjectFactory.

    Specified by:
    registerFixture in interface ObjectFactory
    Type Parameters:
    M - Type of fixture.
    Parameters:
    declarationType - Declaration class
    fixtureFactory - ObjectFactory that will actually perform the instantiation.

    readMappings

    protected void readMappings(String mappingsFilePath)
                     throws IOException
    Initializes the Factory with the type associations that are retrieved from a mappings file. The mappings file contains a list of paths to properties files that can be found inside the local classpath. Each properties file contains associations between a declaration type and an implementation type. Declaration type is usually an interface and implementation type is the concrete class that implements it.
    Implementation type can also be a concrete class. In this case, the corresponding implementation class has to be the same class, or a subclass of the declaration class.
    Different properties files can provide different mapping for the same type. In this case, the last mapping will overwrite any other. This implies that the order in which the properties files are placed in the mappings files catalog, is important.

    Parameters:
    mappingsFilePath - Path to the file that contains the paths to the mapping files.
    Throws:
    IOException
